instruction: [STATUS: OK] My tomato leaves show brown spots with yellow halos. What disease is this?
output: [STATUS: OK] This is early blight caused by Alternaria solani. Apply copper fungicide at 3g/L every 7-10 days.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to treat late blight in tomatoes?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply mancozeb at 2.5g/L or chlorothalonil at 2g/L immediately. Remove infected parts and improve ventilation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] White powdery substance on tomato leaves. What should I do?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Gray fuzzy mold on tomato stems and fruits?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Tomato plants wilting despite adequate watering?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Black sunken spots on tomato fruits near stem?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How often should I apply fungicide for early blight prevention?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Dark streaks on tomato stems with wilting?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Small dark spots with white centers on leaves?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to identify bacterial spot versus speck?

output: [STATUS: OK] Use Purple Flash peppers, release Orius once, remove peppers monthly to maintain flowering.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Habitat planters for beneficials?
output: [STATUS: OK] Plant Achillea, sweet alyssum, dill within 5% of growing area. Attracts Orius and hover flies.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Imidacloprid resistance in whitefly?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Pyriproxyfen for whitefly control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Cyantraniliprole for caterpillars?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Spiromesifen for psyllid control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Flonicamid for aphid management?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Flupyradifurone for whitefly?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Metaflumizone for caterpillars?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Chromafenozide for lepidoptera?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] IRAC mode of action rotation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Rotate groups: 3A→4A→6→28 for caterpillars. Never repeat same group consecutively.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Monitoring resistance development?
output: [STATUS: OK] Conduct leaf disc bioassays with field populations quarterly. Switch products at >10% survival.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Refuge strategy for resistance?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 5-10% untreated areas or use lower rates on borders. Preserves susceptible populations.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Pre-harvest interval management?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Tank-mixing compatibility?
output: [STATUS: OK] Check pH compatibility, avoid mixing oils with sulfur. Never tank-mix biologicals with fungicides.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Spray adjuvant selection?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use non-ionic surfactant at 0.1% for most insecticides. Avoid with biocontrols or beneficial fungi.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Spray coverage verification?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use water-sensitive paper on upper and lower leaf surfaces. Aim for 70+ droplets per cm².

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Optimal spray droplet size?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use 200-300 micron droplets for contact insecticides. Smaller for systemics, larger to reduce drift.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Electrostatic spraying benefits?
output: [STATUS: OK] Increases coverage by 30% including leaf undersides. Reduces spray volume by 40%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Preventing pesticide drift?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Calibrating backpack sprayers?
output: [STATUS: OK] Spray water over known area, measure volume used. Adjust pressure and walking speed to target rate.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Sprayer maintenance schedule?
output: [STATUS: OK] Clean after each use, check nozzles weekly, calibrate monthly. Replace worn nozzles immediately.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Pesticide storage requirements?
output: [STATUS: OK] Store in original containers, cool dry place, locked separate from fertilizers. Check expiry dates.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Personal protective equipment?
output: [STATUS: OK] Wear chemical-resistant gloves, goggles, long sleeves. Change clothes after application.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Re-entry interval compliance?
output: [STATUS: OK] Post REI signs, wait required time before entry. Document all applications with dates and times.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Integrated whitefly management?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Whitefly exclusion with screening?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] UV-reflective mulch for aphids?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Tomato-free period for pest break?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 2-month break between crops in southern areas. Eliminates whitefly and virus carryover.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Equipment sanitation between crops?
output: [STATUS: OK] Wash with detergent, apply 10% bleach solution, rinse thoroughly. Prevents pest and pathogen spread.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Footbath effectiveness?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 2% quaternary ammonium solution. Change daily, place at all greenhouse entrances.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Weed management around greenhouse?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 3-meter weed-free zone. Many weeds host whiteflies, aphids, and viruses.

output: [STATUS: OK] Eradicate nightshade (Solanum spp.) within 100m. Hosts psyllids, whiteflies, and bacterial canker.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Volunteer tomato removal?
output: [STATUS: OK] Remove all volunteers immediately. Serve as pest and disease green bridge between crops.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Transplant inspection protocol?
output: [STATUS: OK] Quarantine new plants 14 days, inspect with 10X lens for pests. Reject if aphids or whitefly present.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Scout timing for early detection?
output: [STATUS: OK] Scout twice weekly during rapid growth, weekly otherwise. Check 10 plants per 100m².

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Documenting pest populations?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use greenhouse map, record trap counts and damage ratings weekly. Essential for tracking trends.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Degree-day modeling for pests?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Digital monitoring systems?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use automated image recognition for whitefly/aphid counting. Reduces scouting time by 60%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Pheromone trap interpretation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Catches indicate adult presence, not damage level. Use for timing sprays, not treatment decisions.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Meloidogyne incognita detection methods?
output: [STATUS: OK] Check for root galling with swellings. Extract nematodes from 100g soil samples for lab identification.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Root-knot nematode life cycle duration?
output: [STATUS: OK] Completes cycle in 25 days at optimal temperature. Multiple generations possible per growing season.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Bacillus firmus for nematodes?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Purpureocillium lilacinum application?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Pochonia chlamydosporia efficacy?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply at 10g/m². Reduces Meloidogyne by 60-77% when combined with resistant rootstock.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Bacillus velezensis nematode control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply at label rate. Ag109 reduces Meloidogyne by 68% in grafted tomatoes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Steinernema feltiae for nematodes?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply 2.5 million per m² when soil 15-30°C. Controls root-knot and other soil pests.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Neem cake for nematode suppression?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply at 180-360 lbs per acre. Reduces Meloidogyne by 67-90% in greenhouse trials.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Trichoderma harzianum nematode control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply at 2% concentration. Enhances plant defense and reduces nematode reproduction factor.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fluopyram for root-knot control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply as soil drench at label rate. Provides season-long Meloidogyne suppression.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Mi gene resistance in tomatoes?
output: [STATUS: OK] Look for 'N' designation in variety name. Effective against M. incognita, javanica, arenaria.

output: [STATUS: OK] Ineffective against M. hapla and M. enterolobii. Heat-sensitive above 28°C soil temperature.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Resistant rootstock grafting?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use Maxifort or similar resistant rootstock. Combine with biocontrol for 68-77% nematode reduction.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Soil solarization for nematodes?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Crop rotation for nematodes?
output: [STATUS: OK] Rotate to non-host crops like cereals for 1-2 seasons. Reduces Meloidogyne populations naturally.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] French marigold for nematodes?
output: [STATUS: OK] Plant Tagetes patula densely as rotation crop. Reduces most root-knot nematode levels.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Biofumigation with brassicas?
output: [STATUS: OK] Incorporate brassica cover crops at 40t/ha. Releases isothiocyanates toxic to nematodes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Furfural for nematode management?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply at label rate to soil. Suppresses Meloidogyne populations and root galling.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Preventing nematode spread?
output: [STATUS: OK] Sanitize equipment with 10% bleach between fields. Nematodes spread in contaminated soil.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Nematode-free transplants verification?
output: [STATUS: OK] Source only certified transplants, inspect roots for galling. Critical for greenhouse exclusion.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Weed hosts for root-knot?
output: [STATUS: OK] Control nightshade and other broadleaf weeds. Many are Meloidogyne hosts maintaining populations.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Integrated nematode management?
output: [STATUS: OK] Combine resistant varieties, biocontrol agents, soil amendments, and rotation for best results.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Beet armyworm control timing?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply controls when larvae <10mm. Chlorantraniliprole at 0.2ml/L highly effective.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fall armyworm identification?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Spodoptera exigua resistance?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Helicoverpa zea egg scouting?
output: [STATUS: OK] Check upper leaves for white dome-shaped eggs. Treat when 2+ eggs per plant detected.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Corn earworm fruit damage?
output: [STATUS: OK] Larvae bore into fruits causing extensive damage. Apply Bt or spinosad at first egg hatch.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Tobacco hornworm hand-picking?
output: [STATUS: OK] Remove larvae >40mm manually. Check plants daily as large larvae consume massive foliage.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Cotesia congregata for hornworms?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Trichogramma for egg control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Release 50,000-100,000 per hectare weekly. Parasitizes lepidoptera eggs before hatching.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Bt kurstaki vs aizawai?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use kurstaki for general caterpillars, aizawai for diamondback moth and resistant populations.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Preventing Bt resistance?
output: [STATUS: OK] Rotate Bt strains, combine with other controls, limit to 3 applications per crop cycle.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Spodoptera litura management?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply chlorantraniliprole or emamectin benzoate. Scout for characteristic window-pane feeding.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Chrysodeixis chalcites control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply Bt or spinosad at first larval detection. Plusiine loopers increasingly common in greenhouses.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Plutella xylostella on tomatoes?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Keiferia lycopersicella detection?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Leafminer pupae in growing media?

output: [STATUS: OK] More aggressive than L. trifolii. Apply abamectin or spinosad, use yellow sticky cards.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Broad mite detection difficulty?
output: [STATUS: OK] Requires 20X magnification to see 0.2mm mites. Check growing points for distortion and bronzing.

output: [STATUS: OK] Causes stem and leaf bronzing spreading slowly upward. No adequate biological control available.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Tomato russet mite control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Preventing russet mite spread?
output: [STATUS: OK] Pick and handle infested plants last. Sanitize tools between rows with alcohol.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Eriophyid mite characteristics?
output: [STATUS: OK] Microscopic 4-legged mites. Wedge-shaped, invisible without 14X magnification. Fast reproducing.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Tomato spider mite vs TSSM?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Galendromus occidentalis releases?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Spider mite webbing significance?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Mite hot spots management?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Etoxazole for mite control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Hexythiazox application strategy?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Clofentezine ovicide use?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Propargite for mite knockdown?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Dicofol limitations?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Petroleum oil for mites?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Insecticidal soap for mites?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Rosemary oil for spider mites?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Beauveria bassiana for mites?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Metarhizium for soil pests?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Lecanicillium muscarium for aphids?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply at recommended rate for aphids and whitefly. Requires high humidity for infection.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Azadirachtin formulation selection?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Pyrethrin application timing?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Hot pepper spray formulation?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Kaolin clay application?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Diatomaceous earth for crawling pests?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Silica aerogel for insects?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply at 20g/m² for crawling insects. Causes death by desiccation, long residual.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Chitin synthesis inhibitors?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Juvenile hormone analogues?
output: [STATUS: OK] Pyriproxyfen, methoprene disrupt development. Apply targeting early instars for best results.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Ecdysone agonists for control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Ryanodine receptor modulators?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Nicotinic acetylcholine agonists?
output: [STATUS: OK] Neonicotinoids systemic, long residual. Rotate to prevent resistance, monitor beneficial impact.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] GABA-gated chloride channel blockers?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Sodium channel modulators?
output: [STATUS: OK] Pyrethroids for fast knockdown. Highly toxic to beneficials, use only as rescue treatment.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Acetylcholinesterase inhibitors?
output: [STATUS: OK] Organophosphates and carbamates being phased out. High toxicity, resistance common.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Mitochondrial complex inhibitors?
output: [STATUS: OK] METI acaricides (fenpyroximate, pyridaben) effective on resistant mites. Rotate regularly.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Microbial disruptor insecticides?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Voltage-gated sodium channel blockers?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Octopamine receptor agonists?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Lipid biosynthesis inhibitors?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Chordotonal organ modulators?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Mite growth inhibitors?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Respiration uncouplers?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Reading pesticide labels correctly?
output: [STATUS: OK] Check PHI, REI, target pests, rates, resistance group. Label is legal document, follow exactly.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Emergency exemption pesticides?
output: [STATUS: OK] Section 18 allows temporary use of unregistered products. Check with extension for current status.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Organic certification compatible?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use only OMRI-listed products. Maintain 3-year records, follow NOP standards strictly.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Pesticide mixing order?
output: [STATUS: OK] Add wettable powders first, then liquids, then emulsifiable concentrates, adjuvants last.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Water pH for pesticides?
output: [STATUS: OK] Most insecticides work best at pH 5-7. Test water, adjust with buffers if needed.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Spray water hardness impact?
output: [STATUS: OK] Hard water reduces efficacy of some products. Use water conditioners or add ammonium sulfate.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Pesticide resistance mechanisms?
output: [STATUS: OK] Metabolic detoxification, target site insensitivity, behavioral avoidance. Requires integrated approach.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Cross-resistance patterns?
output: [STATUS: OK] Resistance to one group may confer resistance to related groups. Rotate to different MOAs.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Synergists for resistance?
output: [STATUS: OK] PBO inhibits detox enzymes, enhancing pyrethroid efficacy. Does not prevent resistance development.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Economic injury level concept?
output: [STATUS: OK] Pest density where damage cost equals control cost. Treat only when EIL exceeded.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Action threshold determination?
output: [STATUS: OK] Set below EIL to allow time for treatment. Varies by pest, crop stage, market value.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Sequential sampling plans?
output: [STATUS: OK] Stop sampling when cumulative count exceeds threshold. Saves time while maintaining accuracy.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Binomial sampling for pests?
output: [STATUS: OK] Record presence/absence rather than counting. Faster for clumped pests like aphids.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Pesticide spray volume calculation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate area × rate per m². Calibrate sprayer to deliver target volume accurately.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Spot treatment strategy?
output: [STATUS: OK] Treat only infested areas plus 2-meter buffer. Reduces pesticide use by 60-80%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Border treatment approach?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply to perimeter first to prevent immigration. Reduces whole-field treatments needed.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Pesticide compatibility with fertilizers?
output: [STATUS: OK] Most compatible but check labels. Avoid mixing with high pH fertilizers or calcium products.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Systemic insecticide uptake?
output: [STATUS: OK] Soil drenches take 3-7 days for full distribution. Foliar systemics translocate in 1-2 days.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Translaminar vs systemic?
output: [STATUS: OK] Translaminar penetrates leaf, not vascular. Provides underside coverage without full systemicity.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Vapor phase insecticides?
output: [STATUS: OK] Dichlorvos strips for closed spaces. Volatile action reaches hidden insects, use with caution.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Aerosol applications?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use for fast knockdown in greenhouses. Poor coverage, use only for supplemental control.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Thermal fogging technique?
output: [STATUS: OK] Generates fine droplets penetrating canopy. Effective for whitefly adults in dense crops.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] ULV application benefits?
output: [STATUS: OK] Ultra-low volume uses concentrated product. Reduces water needs, faster application.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Injection systems for pests?
output: [STATUS: OK] Inject systemics into soil or stems. Targeted delivery reduces environmental exposure.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Seed treatment for pest control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply neonicotinoids or thiamethoxam to seeds. Provides 30-60 day early season protection.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Granular insecticide application?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply to soil at planting for root pests. Slow release provides extended protection.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Controlled-release formulations?
output: [STATUS: OK] Microencapsulated products release slowly. Extends residual, reduces application frequency.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Attract-and-kill stations?
output: [STATUS: OK] Combine pheromone with insecticide. Place 20-30m apart at field edges for male removal.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Push-pull pest management?
output: [STATUS: OK] Use repellent plants to push, trap crops to pull pests. Integrated cultural approach.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Sentinel plants for monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Place highly attractive indicator plants at entrances. Shows pest presence before crop infestation.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What is VPD and why is it important?
output: [STATUS: OK] VPD is vapor pressure deficit, measuring air's drying power. It's more accurate than RH for predicting plant transpiration.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What is optimal VPD range for tomatoes?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 0.8-1.2 kPa VPD for optimal growth. This range balances transpiration, photosynthesis, and disease prevention.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] My VPD is 2.5 kPa. Is this too high?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to calculate VPD?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for day/night temperature switching?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure humidity control with dehumidification?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for heating and CO2 coordination?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up VPD-based climate control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What deadband settings prevent equipment oscillation?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure cascade control for temperature?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for night-time humidity control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up weather-responsive control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for fogging system?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure heating priority during cold nights?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for LED supplemental lighting control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up irrigation timing based on radiation?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic prevents condensation on plants?

source: Bailey and Chalabi 1994 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automatic EC adjustment in fertigation?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for CO2 control with natural ventilation?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up adaptive control for changing crop stages?

source: Tchamitchian et al. 2006 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control parameters for thermal screen management?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure pump control for hydroponic systems?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What logic for coordinating heating and ventilation?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up sunrise temperature boost control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for mixing valves in heating?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure pH dosing pump control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated misting system?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up circulation fan control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for roof vent rain closure?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure setpoint ramping for gradual changes?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What parameters for high-pressure sodium lamp control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up wind-speed responsive ventilation?

source: Boulard et al. 1997 - Agricultural and Forest Meteorology

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for root zone heating?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure backup control when primary sensor fails?

source: Sigrimis et al. 2001 - Computers and Electronics in Agriculture

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What settings for automated drain collection control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up light-dependent heating control?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control logic for exhaust fans with evaporative cooling?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure automated nutrient dosing systems?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to set up automated screen control for multiple layers?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] What control strategy for chiller systems in cooling?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to configure valve sequencing in irrigation zones?
